column4: Ok guys I have a problem, Ubuntu refuses to boot into .19 kernel and even the dpkg reconfigure with .19 doesn't show up in the list during boot
maybe the install did not finished ? Tried to apt-get -f install ?
It was working before, but as I was messing to get my usplash settings correct, now it doesn't :(
so, (again) have you tried to apt-get -f install ?
sudo apt-get -f install :: thats i?
yep, if a package has not finished installing, that will finish the install. (making sure all packages are configured)
Will try, but it was installed since it was pushed into the repos
-f install will make sure it's not half-installed
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
you may try to reinstall the kernel. May be something like sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-image-2.6.24-19-generic
that way, if it cannot be reinstalled because of something you've done with usplash, you should get an error message you can start working with (or tell us)
Pastebin?
yep
From my understanding, it worked: http://paste.ubuntu.com/25475/
Yep, looks all right. Rebooting into 2.6.24.19 should work
k em rebooting
didn't worl :(
still only get opyions for 16 and 17
what happen when you reboot ?
that does not sound right according to the pastebin logs you gave, you should take a look at the /boot/grub/menu.lst that update-grub updated. Maybe pastebin it
help if i told ya i was under wubi?
oh, wubi, i don't know how that works (i don't have ms windows here=
menu clearly shows only 17 and 16 listed
yeah, i don't know how wubi works, can't help you there
